useCase.name: Fly to Destination
useCase.description: A UAV is tasked with flying to a remote specific set of coordinates.

preconditions.precondition: The UAV is in the air.
The UAV has been assigned target coordinates as its final destination.
The UAV has received flight authorization to fly to its destination.

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV arrives at its destination in a timely manner without incident.

failureEndConditions.condition: The UAV fails to arrive at its destination coordinates in a timely manner.
The UAV experiences a collision with an obstacle or the terrain along the route.

useCase.trigger: The UAV has been assigned a set of destination coordinates and has received flight authorization by the FAA.

mainSequence.step: DroneResponse decomposes the entire flight path into a series of flight legs, each one with its own target waypoint.
DroneResponse establishes an initial altitude of the flight and assigns it as the starting altitude of each individual leg.
DroneResponse checks the starting flight leg to ensure that it does not pass through any prohibited airspace whilst maintaining its starting altitude.

DroneResponse uses a terrain map to check the altitude of the flight leg's terrain to ensure that the UAV maintains minimum terrain separation whilst maintaining the starting altitude of the current leg.
Steps 3-4 are repeated for each flight leg.
Given the flight plan, the UAV checks that it has sufficient battery power to reach its destination and determines that it has sufficient power to continue.
The UAV leases airspace for the current flight leg.
The UAV ascends or descends to the target altitude of the current flight leg.
The UAV flies to the destination waypoint of the current flight leg.
The UAV reports its arrival at the flight leg's destination waypoint.
Steps 6-8 are repeated until the UAV reaches its final destination.
The use case finishes when the UAV assumes the task assigned for it to do at its final destination.

esteps.description: The UAV determines that it lacks sufficient battery power to complete the mission.
esteps.step: The UAV notifies the human operator and awaits further instructions.

esteps.description: The UAV will pass through prohibited airspace.
esteps.step: An alternate flight path is planned around the prohibited airspace and/or at a new altitude.
If necessary, the flight path is divided into a series of waypoints representing multiple flight legs.
Steps 2 and 3 are repeated until a viable flight path is found.
If no viable flight path can be found, the operator is notified and the flight is cancelled.
If a viable flight path is found, the original series of flight legs is updated with the modified legs.

esteps.description: The UAV has been assigned a task that requires additional battery power (e.g., return to home coordinates, survey the landscape).
esteps.step: The UAV estimates power requirements for completing the entire task.
If a return home is required, the UAV estimates power requirements for returning home.
The UAV estimates total battery requirements required and determines whether it can complete the entire mission.
If the UAV determines that it has sufficient power to complete the entire mission, the use case continues with steps 7-11.
If the UAV determines that it lacks sufficient power to complete the entire mission, Exception Use-Case #2 is executed.

esteps.description: The UAV is unable to lease the requested airspace after several attempts.
esteps.step: The UAV notifies the operator that it was unable to lease airspace for the planned flight.
The operator decides how to respond and either:
Replans the route and the use case continues at step 7.
